Hey!

I'm Gonzalo Spota, a freelance front-end web developer living in Buenos Aires, Argentina.

Some of my work

Domo KcK

Home automation

A simple site to demostrate the simplicities and perks of a smart home.

On this example, I used Foundation's Flex-Grid to easily generate a fine-looking website on both mobile and desktop versions, as well as a few jQuery plugins to handle validations, animations and a cool slider.
It also features a form made with PHP.

Check it on GitHub

BISPO

Backline rental service

Developed a complete site for backline items listing, such as mixing consoles, guitars, drums, etc.

Made with PHP as the backend to dynamically load items from a MySQL DataBase.
This site also features a custom CMS for quickly adding, updating or removing an item.

Check it on GitHub

almundo.com API

Hotel search component

While browsing looking for a challenge to test my Angular and NodeJS knowledge, I found this exam for a job entry at almundo.com.

It is a simple, yet demanding to make, SPA for displaying a list of hotels that is stored on a Mongo DataBase (NoSQL), that lets the user filter based on stars or search for a specific hotel name.

Check it on GitHub

This site!

Portfolio website

It may seem like it isn't much, but I keep on learning a lot on every single thing I've done, even if it is as simple as this.

I figured that I needed to organize my code, and minimize my time coding while at it, so I started using a lot of the tools available today to meet current web-dev standards, such as a package manager (NPM), a module bundler (Webpack), a task runner (Gulp), a HTML template engine (Jade / Pug) and a CSS pre-processor (SASS).

Check it on GitHub
